title: Honoring the South Bronx Mental Health Council upon the occasion of hosting its 20th Annual Patient Recognition and Empowerment Day
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  the South Bronx Mental Health Council
upon the occasion of hosting its 20th  Annual  Patient  Recognition  and
Empowerment Day on January 28, 2011

WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of  this Legislative Body to commend those
illustrious organizations within the State of New York whose  focus  and
intent  have  made  a substantial impact on the quality of life in their
communities; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor the
South Bronx Mental Health Council upon the occasion of hosting its  20th
Annual Patient Recognition and Empowerment Day on January 28, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  A  multi-cultural,  free standing, not-for-profit community-
based organization, the South  Bronx  Mental  Health  Council  has  been
providing  ambulatory  mental health services to the Bronx community for
42 years and is the primary community-based mental health  provider  for
Community Planning Boards 1, 2, 3, and 4; and
  WHEREAS,  The  multi-cultural,  multi-lingual staff at the South Bronx
Mental Health Council consists of professionals,  paraprofessionals  and
support  personnel who take into account each patient's culture, socioe-
conomic background as well as  chemical  abuse  and  medical  conditions
which impact on treatment outcomes; and
  WHEREAS,  To  meet  the  needs  of  the 294,000 residents of the South
Bronx, the services and programs at the South Bronx Mental Health  Coun-
cil have grown throughout the years and now include outpatient services,
day programs and community residences; and
  WHEREAS,  To acknowledge the achievements made by outstanding patients
over the past year, the South Bronx Mental  Health  Council  established
Patient  Recognition  and Empowerment Day, which recognizes patients for
their leadership qualities, commitment, determination  and  perseverance
in working hard to empower themselves to reach their goals, to emphasize
their strengths and minimize their disabilities; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition, Patient Recognition and Empowerment Day at the
South Bronx Mental Health Council brings  awareness  to  the  community,
government  and  elected  officials  that the services rendered to those
that have a mental disability can help rehabilitate and reintegrate them
back into the community and  maintaining  mental  health  services  will
improve the quality of life of society; and
  WHEREAS,  The success enjoyed by the South Bronx Mental Health Council
is in direct correlation to the efforts of the many individuals who have
supported its development over the years; and
  WHEREAS, Equally commendable are the  superbly-skilled  staff  of  the
South  Bronx  Mental Health Council, whose involvement is and has always
been characterized by an impressive commitment, an unbridled enthusiasm,
and an uncompromising standard of excellence in all of their efforts  on
behalf of the organization and the population it serves; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when organiza-
tions of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor the South Bronx Mental Health Council upon the occasion of hosting
its  20th  Annual Patient Recognition and Empowerment Day on January 28,
2011, fully confident that it  will  continue  to  enjoy  the  sparkling
success which has so characterized its past; and be it further

  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Humberto  Martinez,  Executive Director, South Bronx Mental
Health Council.
